availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James S. Withers (Cynthiana, Harrison County, Kentucky, merchant and cashier bank)

body.p: Cynthiana, Harrison County, Kentucky, merchant and bank cashier. Kentucky native. Son of William A. Withers. Married to Kittie Remington in Harrison County, Kentucky on June 16, 1856. Father of Eliza Withers. Merchant in Harrison County, Kentucky, in 1850. Bank cashier in Harrison County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 1, p. 62A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, Cynthiana, p. 582.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, Cynthiana, p. 178A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Harrison County Marriages, Film #000216896, p. 93.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994037, Harrison County Births, p. 181.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Harrison County, KY, June and July 1863, p. 452.
"James S. Withers (1830-1910)," Find A Grave, Memorial #19481719, accessed June 16, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/19481719.
